intro: Gnidia holstii var. kilimandscharica, commonly known as the Kilimanjaro gnidia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to the cool, arid conditions of its habitat. It is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at elevations above 2,000 meters.
